Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place, great service and good prices.”
Reviews.Author: Elipr
Reviews.Content: Same as above, its a paradise! We enjoy The whole week in a good ambiance with great Prices

Reviews.Title: “Awful management”
Reviews.Author: Juliana M
Reviews.Content: The owner ( whom I think is the son of the previous owner) was rude and arrogant when asked about a service we had already paid ( which was simply using the showers around the pool) It is a shame that a person like this is managing a place that used to be so nice and family oriented. Never going back!

Reviews.Title: “The Sound of the Waves Put You to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Abicla
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to this "parador" twice and love it there!! Ocean swimming, pool swimming, snorkeling, tennis courts, basketball, horse riding among other things available to do. At night you can hear the waves crashing on shore until you fall asleep. We always rent a three bedroom villa with full kitchen and BBQ and make our own meals, which is great and you don't have to spend so much. A big plus is being able to bring our pets for a nominal fee, so they can also join in the fun!!! We love this place and do not hesitate to recommend it, you won't be sorry you came!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the west side's treasures”
Reviews.Author: Karina E
Reviews.Content: This hotel, or "parador", is a jewel. Me and my mom got a special offer and stayed here two nights for the price of one, which was a total bargain. Even the regular tariff is worth every penny, so if you're hesitant, or still undecided, book this hotel, RIGHT NOW. The hotel is totally different from the conventional, big chain hotels. It is made up of cozy, pintoresque cottages, and some two-story villas, which were the ones that we stayed in. Even though it was low season, the facilities were neat and clean, the lawn freshly mowed, and I swear, I didn't see a single piece of garbage around. Right in front of the facilities is the B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L playa montones. There is nothing more refreshing than opening the balcony doors to this magnificent view (and sound) of the oceans. Our room was neat clean, the beds and pillows super comfortable, and the room amenities were of great quality. DO NOT HESITATE TO BOOK THIS HOTEL. It is a different, high quality experience that you don't get from a lot of small hotels around here (besides, you're supporting the local economy and tourism ;)). I would stay living here if I could!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jaytee343
Reviews.Content: Villas del Mar Hau was an experience my wife & I will never forget. Coming from the hustle & bustle of NYC, we were looking for a quiet, serene, beautiful & most important affordable place that was closest to "paradise" as possible. And we hit the jackpot here!! It's a beautifully located spot near Playa Jobos, the staff was excellent, especially Cristina, who treated us like family. Totally unexpected, but well appreciated! We'll definitely go back to "paradise"!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: labeba
Reviews.Content: If you make a reservation on hotels.com and decide to cancel... The hotel will still charge you for one night contrary what the site said, and it's been over two months and I'm still waiting for my money back, I have called multiple times and they always have an excuse, this should have been taken care long time ago... Since I have proof that I shouldn't have been charged 125.00+.

Reviews.Title: “Villas del Mar Hau”
Reviews.Author: cmgp01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Christmas weekend. Facilities were adequate but maintenance and supervision were lacking: Incredibly slow registration process (most could have been done in advance), some windows were stuck, assistance was required with toilets and hot water, gas stove was unstable, some water leaking under the kitchen sink. The beach hut that rents chairs and other beach equipment was closed all weekend, thus we missed renting kayaks and the like. That being said, the beach was beautiful and we were blessed with good weather, which was a big plus. The property has a lot of potential and I would really like to see improvement on the above items so that we may go back and enjoy our stay to the fullest.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place if you like the country side”
Reviews.Author: asoto678
Reviews.Content: we stay for 4 days is a nice place to be i have no complaint at all people there is great .i plan to go back next year

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad food and poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Bully07
Reviews.Content: The cabins are nice and well furnished. Food at the Mar y Arenas restaurant was very bad. You would expect better food and variety. Do not take the offer that includes food, as you will be very dissapointed. I would have paid more for better food and service. Check out process was slow. I had to wait for 30 min, after notifying front desk. Eventually I was allowd to leave as there were no one available to inspect the room. It is a shame, since the place is located in a beautiful area.

Reviews.Title: “Volvere”
Reviews.Author: caguasprrna
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of days off; and wanted to get out of the everyday rush, and found this comfortable, accomodating, relaxing gettaway with the right balance of peace, beautiful scenes, service and privacy. There are no other luxuries other than the natural beauty of the place, the restfull environment and excellent weather for a very affordable price. We are allready planning to come back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacations”
Reviews.Author: greatvacations-11
Reviews.Content: excellent rooms,good air conditioning, very clean, the security is excellent,good parking and a good restaurant,good place to be with friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Like camping on a gorgeous beach!”
Reviews.Author: akorn
Reviews.Content: This place will be a terrific find for those looking for a relatively affordable family hangout on a beach that is nothing short of exquisite in all beachy ways. So let me start with the beach. You go there for the beach because the cabanas are essentially on the beach with a boardwalk and some palm trees between. (In fact, one morning I was up early and a man climbing a palm to hack down coconuts a few feet from the porch was, too.) The beach is shaped like a rounded W with you standing at the bottom. On the left you have a long sweeping arc of gorgeous, rolling surf. White crests, huge sand drag, delightful for lying on your back and letting the waves take you wherever; terrific for body surfing, too. In low tide you can swim in the waves and feel like a fish in a sand bowl, so steep is the ledge formed by the crashing waves. On the right of the W you have "la posita," an amazingly clear stretch of water barely a leg deep at its deepest spot and always calm because of the reef protecting it from the larger ocean. We have a toddler and she was in it 4 times a day, perfectly safe, along with all the others of every age who love lounging around in the water without the athleticism waves require. Best of all, between the reef and the flat, lake-like part is an underwater circular ledge that creates a little lagoon easily navigable for bigger kids and great for snorkeling. If this beach (Montones) sounds good for you, you will enjoy these accommodations because there you are-- no packing or hauling needed. We swam before breakfast, after breakfast, before lunch, after lunch, you get the idea. Also on site are a modest but refreshing pool, a small basketball court, some swings... we never get to using them, but others might find them fun. Now. The cabins I recommend for their porches. Ask for a hammock when you check in. They hang it up for you, and suddenly the non-watery part of your vacation is all set, too. Our 2-month-old could nap in it, our big kids shared it with raucous swinging, I read a whole book there while happily listening to the surf. The porch also comes with an outdoor table and chairs, so you can have all of your meals out there in the shade. We always rent one of the 2BR cabanas with a kitchen, getting groceries at the ECONO market in downtown Isabela and cooking for ourselves all week to save money. The oven is small, but there are four burners on the gas stove top and each unit has a grill outside. You might go to Olas y Arena, the outdoor restaurant nestled between the cabanas with equally spectacular views, for a meal or two, but it's not cheap and only some things on the menu are truly tasty. When you get groceries, pick up dish soap and a sponge. Pack a drying towel. Life will be so much better. And hang or refrigerate your food as though bears are coming. The bugs can be like bears if you give them something to get excited about. The bedrooms are set up well but they're no place to hang out, mostly because housekeeping barely visits and beach places get dirty fast. Same goes for the bathroom, which is fine at first but then icky within hours of arriving and then you're stuck with it. Wear flipflops inside. Bring your own facecloth. Use the mop and pail they leave for you. If you're particular about clean linen and are staying more than two nights, it wouldn't hurt to bring a spare set of sheets. Downtown Isabela is a poor, run-down place. We have family in town so it isn't so bad. But it's certainly no destination for tourists except for groceries. If you're looking for activities, go to the caves or the observatory, go horseback riding a few miles down the coast, or learn to snorkel. And if you want luxury just for a meal, skip this parador's restaurant and drive up the coast 5 minutes to Villa Montana's restaurant, Eclipse. It is spectacularly aesthetically pleasing and worth every penny just to sit in it, never mind eat in it. We have been to these little cabins year after year at different times, and sometimes it's serene and other times it's throbbing with music, so you have to roll with it. Depends on who's there with you because the beach itself is public. Also there's a PA system that the housekeeping uses to communicate and it's rare but a bloody nuisance when they use it. So there's the nitty gritty. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach...”
Reviews.Author: Cyberwoolf11
Reviews.Content: Nice and quit place. Beutifull beach and delicious restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Puerto Rican style”
Reviews.Author: CTorruella
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 just spent 6 nights at Hau. We loved every minute of it and especially were delighted with our two bedroom casita #2. The unit was clean and the linens and towels crisp and freshly laundered--you opened the casita's windows and a wonderful sea breeze ran through it. It was lovely. Do not come here if you are expecting sleep number beds, luxury beach service, teen activities, or infinity pools, but do come if you want to get away from it all in a truly beautiful beach setting. We fell in love with northwest Puerto Rico, the people, the pace of life, the affordability, and the quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views / lousy food”
Reviews.Author: newinpr
Reviews.Content: We were a group of about 40 people ages 40 - 70. The beach was gorgeous and very well maintained. The rooms looked great but we only went for the day. STOP don't eat here! Grab McDonald's or Subway but the food they served us was really lousy. Super small portions but I guess that was ok because it wasn't worth eating it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location - But Never Again”
Reviews.Author: itnest4
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed staying here over the years but the inconsistencies in cleanliness, service, value, sleep quality, etc. have finally driven us to stay elsewhere. Goodbye Hau. We will miss you but won't come back until we are certain that customers are treated fairly and equally.

Reviews.Title: “It really is paradise!”
Reviews.Author: roseprva
Reviews.Content: On a whim, last minute, I decided to stay at Villas Del Mar Hau; and I am so glad I did. This place exceeded my expectations. First off booking was a breeze online via their website. The place was just a little hard to find, but once we called for extra directions, we had no problem finding it. The front desk was great checking us in. We had Villa 18. It was decorated very cute, and very clean. The only thing I could find wrong with the villa was the bathroom was really small, but we didn't spend much time in the bathroom anyway, lol. Villa 18 had 2 bedrooms, small living room and eat inkitchen. Two suggestions I would make is 1. bring an extension cord, because there aren't many electric outlets 2. If you plan on cooking, ask for kitchenwares when you make your reservation. They charge $20 a day to rent a container full of kitchenware, pots, pans, coffeemaker, plates, forks, etc. The grounds were also clean and neat. They even raked around the spots that had no grass, etc. It reminded me of zen gardens :) You can tell that they are constainly upkeeping the place. While we were having a late lunch at the restaurant, an artist was putting little touchs on some murals. The staff was all friendly; from the desk clerk, to the security guards, housekeeping and waitress. I just can't say enough good things about this place! I've stayed at more expensive, "exclusive" places in Puerto Rico these last few years (Interconntential, El Convento, Bahia Salinas, to name a few); but I truly believe this place gave me the biggest "bang" for my money! PS. free wifi that actually worked every time I wanted to connect!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Weekend in Isabela”
Reviews.Author: Imedina806
Reviews.Content: I have two teenager daughters and when they were younger I always visited the beach in front of the hotel. From time to time I stayed there and it was an ok experiance. This January I decided to visit Puerto Rico and bring my wife to the West side of the island. In the spur of the moment I decided to drive in and ask the ladies at the front desk if they had any vacacies. Not only did they offer me what I thougth I was not going to get (being high season) they offer me a great rate without too much effort on my part. It was around 1:30pm and the clerk said that althoug the check in time was not until 5pm we could go right ahead and check in at that time. I was given a great 2nd floor unit right in front of the ocean. It was as clean as you can expect a beach front hotel to be. It was very large and it came with a kitchen. We droped our bags, got dressed for the beach and headed over for the sand. As we walked toward the beach I asked an attendant if they had beach chairs, and we got 2. Since it is a public beach there is not attendants on it but the restaurant was a very nice place to eat a few things and continue a great afternoon. The hotel was undergone a number of great updates and the most noteable is the staff. Everyone was very helpfull and work toward making out stay enjoyable. At check out no issues, just your standard "let us check the room" and off we went. This location is the one you need when you want to get a away for a couple days and you dont need to be bother. If you are looking for the Ritz, this is not it, but if you just want to get away and not having to take a second mortgage while having a great peacefull time, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Viviana024
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay with my husband. We love it. We really recommend it to anyone. We stayed at Villa #2, it was very clean, ,spacious and comfortable. Next to the beach. Personnel Staff were very friendly and willing to help you. We would stay again here!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Muy bueno!”
Reviews.Author: dradiaz
Reviews.Content: We stay for 2 nights. The room vas ok for the price, good a/c, direct tv, clean bathroom, and a great view,but the mattress was in very bad shape and the bed linen was a little stinky. All cabins all in front of the beach so get used to the relaxing sound of the waves! Yeap, I read there was dogs around and they were.. indeed, very friendly (3 big dogs). They charge us $30 for our 2 pound chihuahua and they have 3 "yellow dogs" in the surroundings :s. There no horse back ridding, as announced, but you can rent bicycles and kayaks in teh front desk. Surroundings need care ASAP, we found a pantyliner on the beach,dog feces in the gardens, bottles, etc. Manteinance personel work on Saturdays and Sundays so we heard the trimer and the drill in our room, I think they need to do those things in the week. Restaurant food was great! We got the meal package and is worth it but have patience cause the service on breakfast is very slow. We are planning on getting back with the family cause is a really nice place, with a great potential, is a shame the owners do not exploit it. They are remodeling so I hope it includes new bed linen, mattress and cleaning the surroundings, that's all it needs to be A+.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud!”
Reviews.Author: indigofire
Reviews.Content: Please do not give them your credit card number! After reading here on TA about others reservation issues, I called Del Mar Hau through their "contact us" number (787) 872-2045 as advised by other posters. After speaking with them, I just had a bad feeling about their process and continued to read more reviews here. After reading about credit card billing issues others had, I called them back to cancel. I called within a half hour of making my reservation; spoke with both Elizabeth and Lourdes. I said our plans had changed and I needed to cancel. I verified several times that our credit card would not be charged. I was assured that since it had only been a half hour there was no way we would be charged. A full two months later our credit card bill arrived with their charge! They are such scammers - They must have held on to my number and tried to slide it through with holiday charges (I called them in October 2010 and they charged on my Dec 27th statement) Please do not reserve with them. They have a reputation of fraudulent charges!

Reviews.Title: “nasty dirty place”
Reviews.Author: Cantarrana94
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place. Be careful when you make reservations via credit card. I refused to check in when I saw the unsanitary conditions of the restaurant. I lost my advance deposit ($367 ). The owner did not cooperate at all. I was willing to pay a cancellation fee but they would not care. Poor service and arbitrary business practices. This was a real nightmare specially travelling with young children. I was in despair in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great but ...”
Reviews.Author: pilgrimbee
Reviews.Content: We booked reservations for the Christmas holidays last year and when we arrived discovered that they did not have our reservation despite the fact that we had a confirmed reservation number. They insisted we had no reservation. We showed them our confirmed printout. After an hour of wrangling, they managed to find us a villa for that night but the next two nights we'd have to spend elsewhere. The manager never came out to talk with us or to apologize but agreed to give us that one night free because of the mix up. Other than that, we loved it there. Our villa was clean and bright and right on the beach. The beach was magnificent ... miles of white sand. The poo, however,l was too crowded to use and the restaurant menu very limited. If we go back, we will phone first to confirm our confirmation and we will bring our own groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, but it could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Genesis12
Reviews.Content: Since we arrived we enjoyed the facilities. The beach is very nice and beautiful but the rooms where dusty and smelly when we arrived. They don't have enough personel to properly take care of the guest and the room maintenance isn't very good. The Parador restaurant doesn't offer a lot and is very pricey. They need to come up with better offers for the guest that are staying here like an "all inclusive".

Reviews.Title: “It was Relaxing, Enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: venuslovesun
Reviews.Content: We went there to celebrate birthday and Mothers Day, we had a very good week-end. The place is beautiful. The staff is very nice. It has a BEAUTIFUL beach. We are planning on going back same time, next year (God Willing). We recommend, Villa del Mar Hau, for families with small children because, the beach is very safe, and for couples, because is very romantic. We Love it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, colorful cottages on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: viajero5
Reviews.Content: Just sitting on the balcony and looking at the gorgeous ocean was such a pleasure. We had a one bedroom cottage without a full kitchen. It did have a microwave, coffee pot, and small refrigerator though. It was enough for us. We bought food and drinks from a grocery store in Isabela and enjoyed drinks on the balcony as well as breakfast. Waking up to the beautiful view and sitting on the balcony lingering over breakfast was a treat. Some of the negative reviews here go on about the "resort". I'm not sure that they advertise as a resort. They are very casual beach cottages. A lot of families were staying here and it appeared as if everyone was having a great time. This is not at all a luxurious place but it was clean, comfortable, and very enjoyable. I regret that we had time to stay only one night here.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Book This Hotel via the number listed”
Reviews.Author: mbros
Reviews.Content: As previously stated by a previous reviewer, the hotel's reservation system is a complete mess. I booked through the number listed on their website and on Trip Advisor. The agent "booked" me a 2 bedroom eco-villa, which was not available. I didn't find this out until a week later, when someone from the hotel called me to tell me that they don't have ANY rooms available and the agent should not have taken the reservation. The hotel is refusing to refund my $1600, and said I needed to call the reservation company. Of course there is no answer at the "customer service" department at the reservation firm. When I asked the woman at the hotel why they are using such an bad system and don't list their front desk number ANYWHERE, she said she was sorry and didn't know. By the way -- if you want to actually reach someone at the hotel, their number is: [--]. Don't get fleeced like i did and others who have written the same thing below!

Reviews.Title: “A great casual family get-away”
Reviews.Author: EDelaney
Reviews.Content: This will be the third year visiting Parador Villas del Mar Hau with my husband and 8 year old son and 6 year old daughter. It is a great place to relax and enjoy a beautiful beach. Every morning we wake up to a spectacular view of the beach and ocean that is literally only steps away. We love that we have the best of both worlds: waves to jump and ride on the ocean side and then the calm warm water of the lagoon. The lagoon is a perfect and safe place to walk into and snorkle in the drop off. The staff is fun and friendly. It's in a good location that every year we take the kids for an adventurous day trip; one year to the lighthouse and pirate ship at Arecibo and last year cave exploring at Guajataca. At night without the kids we visit the local casino for some grown up fun. Or we often just sit on our porch and relax. Great time every year. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TomandUrs
Reviews.Content: We always have a great time!!! The staff if very friendly and helpful. We just sit on the beach from morning to sunset. We are going back again real soon. My husband and I can't wait. This is our 3rd time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: pnm624
Reviews.Content: Great place to relax and unwind from everyday life. Beach is beautiful, snorkeling is fantastic. Rooms right on the beach with balconys. Watch the whales jump in the water from your balcony. One restaurant and food is very good. There is a nightlife up the road with a couple of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: loriandjimmy
Reviews.Content: place is beautiful, the resturant is great and the staff was very nice and very helpful. I would recommend and I am returning this year with the same group. can not wait to stay again. one of puerto ricos best kept secrets. we had so much fun the beach is beautiful and peaceful. The hotel staff is great very friendly and helpful. I feel like part of the family when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust "confirmed reservation"”
Reviews.Author: PallidinMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Hau de Mar uses an internet reservation system. Upon check-in, we presented our printed version of Hau de Mar's e-mail to my wife confirming our 3-night stay and which also contained our confirmation number. The check-in clerk informed us, "You do not have a confirmed reservation because our internet service never informed us of your reservation." In addition, this clerk's "supervisor" stayed in her office, even after two separate visits by this clerk to help us, never came out to apologize nor to offer consolation. In addition, they referred and sent us to a far inferior place, the "Costa Dorada," which I'd never recommend to anyone. If you reserve at the Hau de Mar, CALL, CALL, and CALL them directly, again and again, and get multiple confirmations of your reservation and WHO it is you talked to. And do NOT trust their "internet service." They did give us one free night, but, as one reviewer wrote, while the room was "free" that night, everything else was a "nickle and dime" rip-off! A beautiful place -- too bad about the terrible management!

Reviews.Title: “What a trip, well worth the wait!!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMartinez
Reviews.Content: Came down from New Jersey with my 3 kids for a little get away before we get hit with the snow storms and this trip was well worth the wait!! This was like a little village located right on the beach.Cozy 2 bed room cottages that acomadated my family very well.It truly is "a little hidden place in paradise ".My kids enjoyed the pool,basket ball court ,and my oldest daughter just loved there sand volley ball court.On my behalf my favorite part was laying on the hamock watching the sun set every night while i was there ..it was breath taking!!! We all want to come again and soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach Cottage”
Reviews.Author: loggerhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parador Villas del Mar Hau for 5 nites in November. It was absolutely beautiful. The room was clean and the staff very helpful. Our flight was delayed and we arrived at 4AM. 1 very important hint is you need to rent a car. We never saw 1 taxi the whole time that we were there. We wanted to go to different places anyway so we already planned the car. Charlies car rentals is the one to go with. They are friendly and even had us follow them to the main street that our hotel was on. The manager was waiting for us, to make sure everything was OK. The view and the beach were outstanding. We were there over a weekend and there were 3 weddings held right in front of the restaurant in the hotel. Just further testimony that the beach and view were beautiful. I am very glad that I was not swayed from staying here by the few negative reviews. I am not sure if the restaurant is closed during the week all the time but it didn't matter. It was more fun to try other places and tour the island. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: silmarie
Reviews.Content: I wish someone would tell the customer service people (and owner), that there is no reason for a middle age couple to be asked for $10.00 and leave their drivers license with the two young guys at the gate (to be returned upon departure), when our purpose was to have a late lunch at the Olas y Arenas Restaurant, located in the hotel premises. This has been our second such experience in this hotel, while trying to gain access to the restaurant. I can understand this if access is denied to people with questionable appearance, but this was not our case. This happened in July 3rd this year. We were thinking of, depending on the restaurant's quality, make a reservation for a week's stay, but I have been convinced otherwise, which we will share with our friends. Hope they have a solid clientele throughout the year, because with this attitude possikble guests are not motivated to make reservations.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE FOUND!!!”
Reviews.Author: ISALBELLA
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting PR every year for 13 yrs and have stayed at many Paradores and Villas Del Mau Hau was definitely the best of them all!!!What a location! Our cottage was "perched" above a paradise beach. The water there was the most pristine that I have seen in all of Puerto Rico. The snorkeling was unbelievable. We stayed for only 2 nights, loved it so much we wanted to stay more, but all cottages were booked. Our son is 9yrs old and our daughter is 4 yrs old and this was a very safe and fun beach for them. We could sit on our porch and watch them in the water directly in front of our cottage without any worry. The restaurant has great Puertorican food. We had mixed seafood mofongo, which was excellent.I would recommend this place for anyone looking for beach,sun,and relaxation. There is really nothing else to do but enjoy the gorgeous water and nature surrounding you. At the end of the day all we could do was put the kids to bed and collapse onto our hamock on the porch and listen to the waves. I plan to return next year and I will be more prepared to spend every minute in the sun-bringing boogie boards,snorkel masks, and surfer body suits (the sun was brutal).

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: t_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I am really surprised by the negative reviews of this hotel, and sorry that I let myself be influenced by them. We booked two nights here and I wished I had booked three instead. Please note that this in NOT an all-inclusive, Isla Verde type resort but a small, family owned place with a series of cabanas and villas. If you are looking for an all inclusive you will be unhappy. If, however, you are looking for a peaceful, gorgeous locations with a laid back air, this is it. We loved it. We booked to late to get a stand alone cabana and wound up in one of the villas, but it was still darn near perfect. Very clean, one bedroom and a separate sitting room/kitchen (kitchen fully supplied except for paper towels), a patio with a barbeque and an amazing view of the ocean, literally steps from the lagoon beach. Two little stores in the town of Jobos where you can get small neccessities, or a bigger town (Isabella) 10minutes further away. We arrived after dark and got lost, of course, (note to self - next time pony up for the gps) and my boyfriend called the hotel and the woman at the desk, who spoke limited English, took the time to find another employee who was bilingual. This second person, Angela, stayed on the phone with us for 15 minutes guiding us into the hotel, as it is really quite secluded. We walked briefly on the beach and went to bed, lulled by the crashing waves. We woke up in the morning sunrise on the beautiful lagoon, and the rest of our trip was perfect. The only thing I cannot endorse is the on-site restaurant, because we did not eat there, choosing to take advantage of the bbq on our patio instead. We are already joking that the Vills del Mar is our "second home, at the beach" and cannot wait to go again. I highly reccomend it. BTW this is a good location if you are going to the Caves or the observatory, but plan on 40minutes to get there, as you are on country roads for part of the way.

Reviews.Title: “bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: cabMichigan
Reviews.Content: This place was a complete scam ! We picked this place because the pictures online looked beautiful. Let me tell you - they had a great photographer ! We were there for my sisters wedding. The rooms were terriable ! When we checked in after a late night of travel we were very disappointed. The room was very small with 2 standard beds that they tried to pass off as queen beds. When making the reservation I had asked for a pull out because we were sharing the room - three people. Of course there was no pull out when we got there and they acted like I was crazy. I threw a complete hissy fit on the people there. I was charged almost 200.00 a night for a complete crap hole. The curtains in the bedroom had mold on them, the room smelled musty, and it was dirty. We ended up changing rooms to a "2 bedroom cabin". It was not ocean front like we had reserved. Because it was really late and I was tired of arguing we stayed one night in this room and then in the morning changed rooms again. This place had windows that would not close, the bathroom widow had no screen in it to keep the bugs out, and there was a huge human hair ball hanging from the window in the shower. It was dirty ! The 3rd room we stayed in was a little better, most of the windows closed but it was still dirty. There were ants coming out of the molding around the sink and counter also. The only way to stop them was to shove bleach wipes in the cracks around the whole counter. As far as a "kitchen - ha - There was a stove that looked like it was from the 60"s. No microwave and the refrigerator barely kept things cold. My whole family got the shaft on their rooms. I did not go barefoot in any of the rooms. I had to wear my flip flops in the shower ! There was no hot water in any of the sinks or shower in any room. Not even in the rest room in the restraunt. My sister had already made the wedding plans here so I had to settle and stay. If I was alone, I would have left on day one. The wedding planner was ok - but let me tell you they try to charge you for every little thing...if you don't watch they switch and change things at last minute and hope you don't notice. I think the planner could have been more helpful. The wedding itself turned out beautiful. The beach was just ok - it was crushed shells to the left and sand to the right. We walked to the lava rocks and it was rough on the course sand. It was really beautiful. On our way back we found small 1" ziplock baggies and a couple of used syringes on the beach ! I was terrified we would get a needle stick. I also want to say if you are an animal lover this place will break your heart. There are starving cats and dogs all over the grounds. It is heart breaking - it really upset me. I made sure I fed any scraps I had to the dogs. The dogs were hurt ,diseased, and dirty. The cats had bad eyes and were really dirty too. I wanted to cry everytime I saw one. I would have liked to help them all. I did see a stray cat licking out of the "creamer" on one of the tables in the restraunt. The waitress shooed it away and left the creamer ! It was drinking it and she left it !! She was one of the really rude waitresses at the resort dining area. The dining was an not exactly the greatest either. The food was good but the service was terriable. It took 2-3 hours to get a meal and there were hardly any people in the place. I don't like to spend that much time eating when I am on vaction. This was the absolute worst place to stay. I think they have one or two good rooms that they used for the photo shoot and the rest are crap! I guess we were not lucky enought to get the nice rooms! I would never stay here again. It was not worth the money. If I wanted a cabin I would have stayed in Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: greatvaka
Reviews.Content: the location was something out of a dream just beautiful. you have a choice of small to midsize cottage style places which are right on the beach or rooms in a villa your more traditional hotel room. We were in a cottage on the beach, everyone was very friendly and helpful. Everything was very close by (only 15 min. to get to airport ,walmart, supermarket.and the local shops). We really enjoyed the local surfer type bars (Happy bellies and Don Carlos) they both had a great view and very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag - Great location, Kind of loud, prepare to be nickled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: BrendanSmall
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at VDMH. We had 3 cabins spaced out along the beach. The beach is very nice, great for finding shells or playing in the waves. The cabin has a nice porch looking over the water and grills on the side of the cabin. Nothing fancy. These are not luxury cabins, but we were not looking for luxury. We were right next to the main office which turned out to be a bad thing. One morning, early, there were some employees on the porch talking very loudly, just a few feet from our window, another night it was someone revving a car engine that had no muffler for a long time, the next night it was a motorcycle. Add this to the fact that we had 2 people on a postage stamp sized bed. I didn't sleep well there. Avoid Cabin 18. The employees hang out right next to it all night. We rented a cabin with a kitchen and when we got there we found no utensils. At the main desk we were told we had to rent pots/pans etc. Eventually, we got it for free, but I don't usually travel with pots and pans. Then I went to pick up a paper at the main desk. I was told I had to pay 45 cents. I'm paying over $200/night for a non-luxury cabin and you are going to charge me for a paper?!? Come on. On the other hand, my parents were in a smaller room by the restaurant and loved it. My mom said she slept much better than at home. This was my second trip to PR. The first we stayed at Luquillo Sunrise Inn (in Luquillo). The level of service at Luquillo was so much higher, the rooms nicer. If you decide to stay here, do not travel thru Isabela to get there. It is a difficult town to get around, esp at night. Approach VDMH from the east. Much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Although a little rustic, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: Last December American Airlines had a $250 Austin/San Juan round trip special that we couldn't pass up and pushed the "Buy" button! I mentioned the cheap airfare and our friends (other retirees) said "we're in". With a little research we decided to circumnavigate the island staying at paradors and sample the fine Porto Rican food and the rums. What a great idea! I booked our rooms directly over the phone at $125+tax/room/night. We were assigned adjacent two bedroom cottages with full kitchen utensils. The location is great and the sound of the surf crashing right outside your door is worth the lack of luxury accommodations. The cottages were clean and with somewhat dated furniture; but this is a beach cottage, so no big deal. We didn't have time to stay more than one night, but all in our party plan on coming back and staying for a week with fishing tackle. Being the first week in December, we had the restaurant to ourselves. The food was fantastic and the young chef is quiet talented. Don't miss Happy Belly's Bar around the point where the surfer are.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recomend...”
Reviews.Author: jandjtravelteam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights..waste of cash... Nice setup next to the beach, but rooms are in decaying conditions... One night was greeted by 6 or 7 roaches on and around our bed..had to move rooms at 1am... new rooms was better kept but i left with what i beleive are over a hundred or more bed bug bites all over my legs...also make sure you know whats included with your rooms because once there you will be charged 30 to 40 dollars per stay for a fridge, coffee maker, stove..etc... and that charge is per item.

Reviews.Title: “It leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Hermanburglar
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three days at the Mar Hau. We stayed in a little villa without a kitchen. The room was small and the furniture was uncomfortable. The view and location are great. For once I thought I had done my research and that I knew what to expect. I expected the room to be a little rustic but expected the grounds and the resort to be world class. I was right about the room, but the resort was far from world class. This was our fourth trip to Puerto Rico and the first time staying in Isabela. I would not recommend Isabela or Mar Hau. The customer service was terrible. The bar keepers and waiters/ waitresses were awful. The concierge was rude every time we called; we needed directions and they kept putting us on 15 minute hold times. Once we got there they were not any better. The only nice person we found was the security gaurd and the lady who does the horse trips (we didn't even do a horse ride, she was just the only one willing to help at all). As for the resort, it was a blessing and a curse. The beach is great, the water is gorgeous. The facilities were outdated and most things were closed. It seemed as the resort would have been nice twenty years ago. Most of the facilities were closed. The shop was closed, the restaurant and bar were almost always closed. The pool bar / grill was closed. The shack to rent beach chairs/ towels/ umbrellas was closed. We were able to get some beach chairs after a long ordeal with the front desk, maids and groundskeepers. The restaurant, which was supposed to be great, was not so. We had expected to eat most of our meals there, but after getting bad drinks at the bar and a waitress who was downright rude, we never went back. As for the town, unless we missed it, there really isn't one, not in the gringo sense anyway. I was told by a local not to stay there after dark. We spent most of our time at playa jobos and the restaurants/bars there. We did enjoy our stay here and it is very relaxing. I am also the kind of traveler who does not require much, but for $150 a night, I expect a little more. This would be a great resort at $50 a night, but I can stay somewhere much better and get better service for these rates. To quote a couple we met at the pool, " It leaves a lot to be desired". I would suggest going to Rincon instead.

Reviews.Title: “could be much better”
Reviews.Author: tonybetty
Reviews.Content: well we stay for two nites at parador villas del mar hau and for almost $300.00 dollars you dont get what you paying for the rooms are not updated the bathroom looks terrible just one window aircondition unit in the bedroom the beach is very nice but they need to give the costumers more for your money like maybe a phone line or a hair drier or maybe a fridge , clean room service .towels or even more toilet paper. if you have friends coming over they need to pay to get in so i guess i wont stay there next time they need to think that you could pay the same amount in miami beach 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: PPTA
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights in May. We stayed in an upper unit with a fantastic view and always a nice cross breeze with the balcony doors open. The caves in the water made for great fun and adventure for both adults and children. The beach was accessible in both directions for a nice long walk! We ate at the restaurant every night and enjoyed both the ambience and the food. Our compliments to the chef--seafood dishes rated right along those of top restaurants we visited in San Juan for quality and presentation. We drove around PR for 2 weeks and stayed at different locations. This was one of our favorite. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beach and restaurant. Villas and ownership needs a lot of work.”
Reviews.Author: mdez20
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the Parador Villas del Mar Hau the weekend of May 10th, 2008. The location was beautiful with a gorgeous beach and small villas lining the seashore. Pool was adequate for a small resort. Some of the villas have been "upgraded" and some are "rustic". You are not staying at a hotel so be prepared. A trip to Walmart before your stay will help....paper plates/cups, plastic eating utensils, and food and drink to stock the fridge and you should be fine. Have patience with the staff at the reception office, they just handle things differently down there. Our cermony was on the beach and our reception was at the on site restaurant Olas y Arenas. We had 53 people at our reception and Zelma, the owner and chef, rocked the house with her food and bar staff. We had a great DJ and the party was on!!! Overall, the reception exceeded our expectations and Zelma Parra, the owner, was a pleasure! She makes great food and has a wonderful supporting cast who dealt with 50 or so Puerto Ricans from NY. She is a saint!! When this place gets the rooms in order and works on its customer service, it will be an undiscovered gem in a beautiful part of Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: To be totally honest, the primary reason we chose to stay here was because we wanted to have our wedding on Montones Beach, and our reception at Olas y Arenas. It's not mandatory to stay here in order to have the reception there, but it turned out to be extremely convenient. Definitely the best aspect of this hotel is the location. Just about every villa is literally steps to the beach (but be warned that some are not - be sure to ask). If you were to go out on your deck and throw a ball you could probably hit the water. The beach is extremely quiet during the week, and you feel like you've got your own private beach. A lot of villas have kitchens so you can easily run up to your room to get snacks or a refill on your drink. And for the really prepared they have grills (provide your own charcoal). Do yourself a big favor and make a run to the WalMart and supermarket when you arrive to stock up on necessities (out on RT 2, about 15 minutes away). With the exception of the restaurant there is nothing else open or nearby during the week. The snack bar/gameroom did open but not until the weekend. Other restaurants are a short drive away, but probably not within walking distance. The restaurant onsite, Olas y Arenas, is truly a hidden gem. The owner Zelma is a transplanted NYC gourmet chef who creates some of the most delicious dishes I have ever had. We had our wedding reception at her restaurant and to say it was phenomenal would be an understatement. The food was fantastic and her staff went out of their way to make sure we all had a good time. By the end of the night everybody was dancing. Now for some warnings. For starts, the experience with the front desk was unpredictable. Sometimes you will get a very friendly and helpful person, and sometimes you will get the complete opposite. Luckily my wife speaks fluent Spanish which helped a lot. It's also important to note that you have to pay extra for daily maid service, which is really a must. They also provide very limited cleaning supplies for the kitchen (no sponge, paper towels, etc) so you might want to throw some of this into your luggage. As mentioned above, there's not much around besides the beach and the restaurant. Unless you intend to eat at the restaurant for every meal, I'd highly advise getting a rental car. I suppose it is possible to walk to the restaurants near Jobos beach, but it's not a short stroll (btw - the little yellow shack with the white bars on it has some of the best mahi-mahi pinchos you will ever have). Also as mentioned it would be a good idea to make a trip to WalMart or one of the supermarkets to stock up on supplies. Lastly, be warned that if you need to check out early, you have to do so the day before! We learned this the hard way, but luckily my brother in law wasn't leaving yet so he checked us out.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: GrosseIleCyclone
Reviews.Content: Been to this property many times. The key to a pleasant stay is your own attitude. The common language is a smile and the people speak it universally. Lots of kool tourist stuff to do not far away including the Cave at Camuy and surfing at Jobos and Rincon. Happy Belly bar is right up the street for american style bar food. The pueblo grocery store is about a 20 minute Drive. We suggest staying clear of Isabela itself......Strange Vibe there. A great day trip would be to the lighthouse on the southwest corner of the island..........perfect half moon beach. The quietest cabins are on the far east side of the property on the far side of the Hau Family home. This area is also double gated for those concerned about security. Jan and feb are good months for whale watching and are the best months for surfing. A little rain each day but for the most part perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family”
Reviews.Author: Meredy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove around the island and stayed at this property one night. I think a family would enjoy it. It's set up kind of like a camp. It is a gated property with casitas and condos that overlook the bay. There are horses, a small pool, a basketball court, a restaurant ( where we had the best food of our trip) and a small convenience store. The grounds are well-kept. Just understand that it is not a big, luxury resort. Each unit has a sitting area and one or two bedrooms and a small kitchen with full-sized fridge. The beach is coarser type sand with waves constantly coming in. You can snorkel a little but there's not alot to see. Walking the beach to the left, you come to the next cove, which is a nice public beach with another restaurant for burgers etc. We paid $140 for a king bed, sitting area and kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times!!!”
Reviews.Author: raiderang
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something out of the way, non-resort hoopla with just a bed and a great view and we found it at this place. The room was just ok, basic needs, bed, tv, table and chairs. We've done the big all-inclusive resorts and they sure are nice, but if you are looking for peace and quiet with a fantastic beach and great views then this is the place. We definitely would have loved some better amenites (updated kitchen), but the service Christina provided and the wonderful beach made up for it. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Prices went up and quality went down.”
Reviews.Author: havhorsewiltravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Villas del Mar Hau 3 or 4 years in a row, but have not been back to PR for 3 years. We were in for a shock. The first room they gave us for $124 had indoor/outdoor carpeting that was filthy, windows ditto, the whole room smelled moldy, or ? Spoke with another couple who had had a similar experience. We refused that room and got another with same window condition (looked like they hadn't been washed in the 3 years we weren't there). The draperies hadn't been opened in ages and were very dirty. But it did have a balcony view of beach, and a stove & frig. We left to visit Rincon for 2 nights and called the del Mar Hau to try to get out of the rest of our reservation, but they refused. The "manager" asked what was wrong, so I told him about the rugs, windows, draperies filth. And, they finally gave a room like we were used to, which now goes for $150. In other words they tried.... I think they washed the windows and the curtains didn't smell that bad; tile floors, much easier to keep clean. French doors open out to beach, nice, yes, that's why we came back 4 times. The beach has good snorkling and swimming. Lots of surfers stay in the cottages and split the high cost. So, the "owners/managers" are relying on their incredibly wonderful location and beach to charge their high fees. While, quality suffers. We were there 4 years ago when they bought and were placing the NEW beds. We saw them do it. However, the beds did get pretty worn and uncomfortable in 5 years of frequent use. Also, they don't use mattress pads which help hold the sheets on and can be washed,,,,, so you hope that the sheets fit well enough so you don't end up sleeping directly on the mattress like I did the first night ,,,, not nice. And the restaurant...... whoa, gemme a break. It is common knowledge that the restaurant is no good. Eh food, and really bad service, as witnessed by very few people eating there. One example: fresh PRican bread is baked fresh and delivered everyday, almost everywhere (even the funky local cigar store/mini market). We tried the restaurant once more.... asked for some bread & butter to tide us over and received lousy whole wheat sandwich bread sliced in half with some weird roasted unfresh roasted garlic. Eck, we almost went back to our room to get our fresh bread. All in all, it is really a shame. We are realizing that it is better to stay inland for more reasonable prices and just go visit this beach, Playa Montones, and other beaches. Probably the same elsewhere too. See our positive review of Dos Angeles in Rincon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach and Chef!!”
Reviews.Author: stunts98
Reviews.Content: Went with my partner last year for Valentines loved it so much we are going back this valentines ..If your looking for the real feel of PR then this is the place ,the rooms are not fancy but are very comfortable and have the best view ..The beach and ocean .. Make sure you take a walk down the beach over the rocks ,you will find a beach bar that has cold beers for a buck and any other drink you might fancy ..you can even order food...alot of the locals bring there families there... They have a new chef that is awesome ....presentation of the food is as great as the taste... Hope this review helps I cant wait to go back ...

Reviews.Title: “For a ''take it all off'' experience: stress, anxiety, love breakdown, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Maritza13
Reviews.Content: Best place to unwind and recharge batteries. Contact with nature is awesome. Great ocean views, magnificent beach right in front of you. Just the right place for me,...I can't stop coming back whenever possible

Reviews.Title: “Great View not so great service”
Reviews.Author: PRIETA
Reviews.Content: We had been planning our 4th family reunion and thought it would be great to do in our homeland of Puerto Rico. We started planning April of 05. When we contacted the hotel and informed them that we were having a family reunion (with at least 7 - 10 families in attendance) we requested a special rate and the answer was a resounding NO. That should have stopped us right there but we decided that because of the location and the beauty of the surroundings it would be worth whatever the cost. We rented 9 homes in total (which by the way since we had booked so early we requested that we have as many of the houses one next to the other and they were not able to comply), There were over 40 family members and because we were given such a small time frame to book, several members could not make it . So, those members booked in area hotels and figured we could just go in and spend our time with our families even though we would have the inconvenience of having to travel back out again late in the evening. To our surprise, the first family that arrived wednesday night was told at the gate that they were not allowed to go in unless they were actually staying there. That our only solution was to call our family out to the parking lot to say hello. Had we even known that this was to happen, we would have NEVER booked with them since what good is a family reunion if the rest of the family cannot be with you. The next solution that they gave us was for our family members to pay $25.00 per day EACH person that wanted to come in for the day! Our reunion was from Wednesday thru Sunday!! After much discussion they were then "KIND" enough?! to lower the price to $10.00 per day. Now for those of us who did stay this is what follows: The houses were ok right in front of a beautiful beach. Our problems were; old kitchen equipment, toilets would back up, there were no fresh towels everyday but every 2-3 days, if you needed a clean towel and it was not your day to receive one, you had to pay $0.45 per additional towel. At the last minute we had 1 guest that could not get a room there and since she was travelling alone we thought it best that she bunk with one of us. We did not mind having to pay for her but it was ridiculous that what served as her bed was a twin size matter on the floor costing $45.00 per day... This was a simple mattress!!!! I could go on, but I want to leave the rest for my family to write about, which I am sure they will. It does need to be said that the location was breathtaking, the beaches were both adult and children friendly. As a person whom has been on several trips (as far a Brazil), for once I have been disappointed and in my own backyard. And believe me when I say that Puerto Rico is a truly extraordinary Island with the beaches, hotels and especially the warmth that our people can provided with their open arms and doors at all times. Sadly, Villas Del Mar Hau will not be seeing any of us anytime soon, BUT they will be hearing from us.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: karyn_carlo
Reviews.Content: If you love the ocean, you'll love this place. Cabins all have balconies that open directly on to the beach where you can swim and snorkle. Many have full kitchens so you can cook and save money. All in all, a great place for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.....”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatria
Reviews.Content: We had destination wedding on the beach on 5/5/07 at Parador Villas del Mar Hau and had a memorable wedding. We live in New Jersey and stayed at the Villas 5/2 - 5/6, along with 35 wedding guests that flew in from Florida, Atlanta, New York, New Jersey, and Philadelphia whom also stayed at Parador villas Del Mar Hau. NOTE: The Villas and the Restaurant are separate owned and each has their own management. This was a GREAT advantage. Olas y Arena Restaurant - Their service is outstanding! Our weekend wedding vacation would not have been as wonderful and memorable had it not been for their service during breakfast, lunch, dinner, rehearsal dinner/BBQ and reception. The presentation of the food was phenomenal and the taste was delicious. Luis & Zelma are a great team! All of my guests absolutely LOVED them and their staff. From the moment that we arrived, both Luis & Zelma wanted to meet & greet us. If either one of them saw us, they acknowledge us and made us feel appreciated and welcomed at ALL times. Their main concern was that "La Novia" (the bride) was always HAPPY even if it didn't have anything to do with the Restaurant. Yes, they may be short staffed but Luis wears ALL HATS and exceeds his service as a waiter, entertainer, griller, labor guy, bar tender... I even saw him make many trips to the beach to bring my guest MOJITOS!! I look forward to the Inauguration -- Count on our support! Villas - Are in deed very nice, comfortable and a relaxing place facility. During our stay I noticed renovations being done to some of the Villas which are GREAT! However, they have a pretty long way to go in terms of friendly service and customer appreciation. I began planning my wedding in 5/2006 when I purposely visited the Island to select the venue for my wedding. During this trip I fell in love with the simplicity and secluded area of this location. I was looking for a beach to have my wedding, location for my ceremony and a place to stay for me and my out of town guests. Parador Villas del Mar had it all and I contracted the space for all of the above. Unfortunately, the Villas staff changed at least 3x's and my contract became a big JOKE. I had many unreturned phone calls, left numerous messages for the 1 person assigned to my group block. On numerous occasions I called and was left on hold for a ridiculous long time, sometimes I would hang up and dial again just to get someone live on the phone. Many times I would be told that the person I needed to speak with was either on vacation, gone for the day, out sick and NOBODY else could assist me because only that particular individual I was working with could assist me. As the bride I would have appreciated some "TLC" (Tender, Loving, Care) from the Villa management. Perhaps, a "THANK YOU" for bringing them such a large group, maybe a complimentary stay (1 night at least), or even some VIP treatment, a "WELCOME" bottle of wine, or maybe a simple floral arrangement.... something just to say thank you. I must acknowledge that in my group I had a total of 5 - pre-teens including my son who is 12. they had a wonderful time in the pool, game room, riding horses, basketball courts and the fact that these city kids had the freedom to roam around this guarded facility was a PLUS, PLUS. The fact that I am an event planner in the trade show industry makes my expectations very high. However, customer service is a MUST no matter how big or small your facility is. Will, I stay there again? Yes. I had a beautiful wedding and my son had a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location - Excellent Restaurant - Ready to Book a Week”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: I was originally not scheduled to stay at this hotel. I had booked 2 nights at Ocean Front ([--]) & after an uncomfortable (unbearable?) first night there I left. Thank god I remembered the name "Mar Hau" in the area & was able to book a villa at the last minute. This is not your average property, & that's a good thing. The hotel exhibits what is best in the Puerto Rican way of life -- relaxed, genial & proud. The restaurant is a certified "Meson Gastronomico" & has earned that certification. Fresh lobster & a bottle of rioja cost about 1/2 of what it would cost in the U.S. & was just as good. I would not hesitate to book a week there in the future. The surrounding area doesn't have much at all as far as attractions, but the Mar Hau property is the perfect place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: mcoa
Reviews.Content: As soon as we entered Isabela and saw the view we knew this was the place for us. Once we entered the hotel grounds, it was like a tropical paradise. The hotel staff went out of their way for us. We were upgraded to our own personal cabin overlooking the lagoon. Our cabin was two bedrooms with a living area and kitchen. Very cozy. There is cable tv in the living area and a/c in the bedrooms. We really didn't need the a/c for our visit, just open the windows for the ocean breeze. Don't be afraid to ask staff for anything, they are very accomodating. Housekeeping even did our laundry so we wouldn't lose out on beach time! Anne, who runs the horseback riding, was great! She took us out through the trails and gave us a full tour of the grounds. If you are used to resort vacations, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for peace, quiet and relaxation, this is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “I love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: QuakertownVilla
Reviews.Content: Great place . Very quiet. My kids loved it! I loved this place and am going back next year. All cabins are located directly on a beautiful natural beach. You step out of your cabin and there you are, waves right in front of you.The place is beautiful you have the beach in the facilities the staff is very nice, front desk clerks are very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax”
Reviews.Author: pqAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This is a piece of paradise. I do not see how people writte horrible things about this place. They must have some kind of arrogance of what nature is all about. This is a fantastic place to go and relax forget the troubles. The sound of the ocean the wonderful breeze, you do not even need hot water nor air condition. The people are friendly and I recommend this place to anyone that likes peace and quiete.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Overpriced Cabins”
Reviews.Author: wasame
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this place. The good: All cabins are located directly on a beautiful natural beach. You step out of your cabin and there you are, waves right in front of you. There is a little store on premises that was very convenient, a small pool (we never swam in it), horses to ride, tennis courts, and basketball courts. (Basically, think nice camp site). The bad: Check-in was hectic and we were unable to check in until 5:30 pm (check in is at 5). The cabins are outdated and without maid service, although they do stop by every 2 days to offer new towels. A notice in the bathroom requests that no paper products be flushed down the toilet (read: nasty tp in the trash basket with no daily service to remove it) If the price was less then I would say that I would definitely stay there again, even with all the gliches, because it is on a beautiful spot. But we paid $175 plus resort fee which brought it to $199 per night so I'm not sure.....

Reviews.Title: “Don't go ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is beautiful but the service is awfull... They tried to charge us for an extra night and almost got away with it...Don't go you'll regret it... There are better places i Puerto Rico that are as o more beautiful and with excellent service... Dont ever go to hau...

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was still there...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For those of you seeking the perfectly sterile, air-conditioned goodness of a Holiday Inn, please stay away from these cabanas. It's ok, I won't judging you. However, for anyone looking to experience paradise on an under-developed carribean island, look no farther. I am a native Floridian who recently had the opportunity to visit the island with my girlfriend and her family (all native Puerto Ricans). They booked the place and said it was fabulous, having stayed at Villas Del Mar Hau several times before. I was skeptical, so I looked it up here. Of course, after reading rather nasty reviews, I became worried. I didn't have much of a choice, however (as any of you may understatnd, I was outranked in the politics of Latin family...), so I went hoping to make the best of it. Was the room spotless? Not exactly. However, I'm a bit of a germ-o-phobe, and I had no problem. This was a beach cabana, with everything you could possibly need (sans food supplies - bring everything you may need, including toiletries. Drinking on the beach is allowed, too.) Think of it as posh camping, with a Fridge and kitchen cooking/grilling capacites, on the shores of paradise. I have never seen a finer beach! The water, the sand, the people - all was perfect. As to the complaints of previous posters - I can not agree. With regard to the pool, I have no idea. (Why go in a pool when you have an amazing, crystal clear ocean to swim in?) I had no issue with bugs, save mosquitos outside (bring your bug spray). There were certainly crabs about (charming!), though I found none in my room. And, we stayed in a 6 person cabana with two rather new model a/c units. We left the bedroom doors open to the rest of the place in the day with the units on, and it was nice and cool. At night, our room temp was downright cold. I strung up the hammock I bought in Isabela on my front porch back home, hoping to recapture a little of the magic I found on the beach at Villas Del Mar Hau. I write this review only in the hopes that open-minded travelers will discover this enchanting spot. Beware "Hilton-hoppers" - It is not a resort. These are beach cabanas meant to be a charming and practical "base" for your island and beach adventures. If you're looking for the sterile atmosphere of Disney World, go to Florida. You'll be in good company in the charmless tourist trap that is Orlando. Thankfully, you will find little of that in Puerto Rico. This island, and Villas Del Mar Hau, are the real thing.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of unfair reviews on this site about Villas de Mar Hau. As an American it is embarrassing to me. I live in Santa Rosa, California in beautiful wine country and can't say enough good things about the Villas. I think all the bad reviews come from people that had unrealistic expectations and were expecting a "resort" experience. If you are looking for a crowded concrete jungle beach resort where cabana boys cater to you and serve you tropical drinks w/unbrellas, then you got the wrong place. If you are a fat, dumb American with bad manners and think hotel employees should take your abusive attitude and just smile, you've got the wrong place. I have been there 3 times now and am planning my next trip to go soon. I see a lot of comments about how all the good reviews are from native Puerto Ricans. Yes, you are right. Many city folk from San Juan consider this the ultimate vacation spot on the island. And it's for good reason. It is totally unspoiled. There are not many places left in the world where there are miles of unspoiled beachfront property with just sand dunes and no buildings. If you are into nature and just walking out the front door of your cabin right on the beach and walking a 1/4 mile, only to find yourself with your lover on a deserted beach. : ) Then this IS the place for you. About 70 paces to the right of the Villas is an incredible wading pool, about 6"-1' in depth, perfect for kids to play around in. If you walk further (30 paces) into the wading pool (I'll include a picture) it drops off to an incredible snorkeling area, protected from the waves. Schools of tropical fish swim around and even if you have never snorkeled before this spot makes it really easy. My then 5 year old had an experience of a lifetime snorkeling with me. Swimming around with schools of tropical fish is amazing!!! You really feel connected with nature. By the way the water is soooooo warm and relaxing, no chill factor whatsoever. Truly amazing and very very safe. Obviously the weekends are much more festive and friendly folks from all around the island come there to party, barbeque, play music, dance and generally have a good time. Nothing out of hand, just good clean family fun. If you are looking for solitude then go during the week otherwise on the weekend if you want ot be alone just walk down the beach a 1/4-1/2 mile and there will be no one in site. What I am trying to say here is that this is a place for Puerto Ricans, not fat butt spoiled Americans with attitudes. Blend in, be polite, friendly and the local folk will embrace you with open arms. The cabins right on the beach and I mean right on the beach (the sound of the waves lull you to sleep at night, incredible!!!!!!) are simple and include cable TV but no telephone. Quite frankly I am glad there is no telephone and kind of wish the temptation of TV was not there. There is a restaurant, but you also get a kitchenette with a refrigerator, stove and table. There is also a living room area with a couch and some chairs. The floors are wood and if you track sand into the room no big deal. Each morning the service folk will come in give you new towels, make the beds up and sweep up the floor. Food can be bought in Isabela at 2 different markets. The offerings are simple and if you expect high-end food, it just doesn't exist. Isabela is not a wealthy resort town. Again, if you don't walk around like you own the place and just blend in, the folks there will be genuinely friendly and helpful to you. It is not at all like the locals in Mexico. There was 2 bedrooms one with a Queensize bed that was a little lumpy but totally sleepable and the second room had 2 sets of bunk beds. Ideal for a big family. Windows are not made out of glass, but rather a louvered thick hard platic that open and close like venician blinds. All rooms come eqipped with AC, which is a nice option. Privacy is pretty good, quite acceptable. The bathroom is simple, shower bathtub and sink. Hanging out on your cabin's porch and playing card or board games in the shade is quite relaxing. Bottom line. If you are looking for simplicity of life and getting close to nature this is TOTALLY the place for you. I find the cabins quite charming and feel they serve as a reminder that life does not need to be so complex. If you live a bohemian lifestyle you are absolutly going to fall in love with this place!! Big time!! I have traveled all around the world and can confidently say that if you are into getting out of the rat race and just relaxing in nature, hanging out on a beach with absolutely no one in sight. You will NEVER find a better deal. The price of admission is dirt-cheap. Places like this won't last forever. I feel privileged to have stumbled upon it. Viva Villas de Mar Hau!!!! ps. Jetblue flies right to Aguadilla. 10 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fair warning”
Reviews.Author: samthebutcher
Reviews.Content: having not stayed at Villas del mar Hau I cannot comment on the location or facilities. What I can say about the Villas del mar Hau is based on their service, or lack thereof, which is bordering on fraud. I made a reservation this past April for the final nights stay of our 5th anniversary. In October I had to shorten the trip, which required canceling my reservation. The process was quick and simple. I was well before the 14 day cancellation window and the agent said that a check for the entire nights stay would have to be mailed to me instead of reversing the credit card charges. Two months, ten plus phone calls and four emails have all been ignored. When calling, one cannot talk to someone in administration unless between the hours of 8 and 4. When calls are made within these hours I have heard all sorts of reasons as to why the check has not arrived; "system down, check cutting agents on vacation, it's in the mail, can you call back?". I was even hung up on once and when I called back there was no answer. On two ccasions when they said they would return my calls in 10-15 minutes, no call was returned. The four email messages sent to the hotel have never been responded to. I have now contacted my credit card agency to reverse the charges. I have also contacted the Puerto Rico tourism board to let them know just how one of the hotels in their paradore program treats customers. I recommend shying away from this hotel unless you do not value your money! Dealing with this hotel has proven to be one giant headache.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beatiful place. Like being in paradise.Very clean and woderful service. It really meant a lot. I recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: pearlie_one
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 2004 and am returning next month. This is NOT a fancy schmancy place. Do not expect resorty snobbery here. Expect rustic cottages right ON the beach - where you can surf on one half & snorkel on the other half. This place is totally laid back. If you have a problem with sweeping your own porch or you plan to spend your vacation inside a room, go elsewhere. If you love natural beauty and plan to enjoy meals you grill yourself, and eat on the porch overlooking the sea, after a day of playing on the beach or horesbackriding, This place is fabulous. A little rough around the edges? Perhaps. Worth it? Absolutely. Simple bunkbeds in a cabin sound appealing to you? Different strokes for different folks. This is not your stuffy, fabricated environment with no character. I am counting down the days until I return!

Reviews.Title: “I'm so glad I cancelled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of you who wrotte a review about this hotel I cancelled my reservation on 9/2/05 for the stay on 12/16/2005, and I can't beging to tell you the frustration and the phone calls I'm making to get a refund of a deposit that they charged to my credit card without my authorization which I wasn't aware till I called to cancel. So far I had to get my credit card company involve in order to get the refund but everytime the company contact them they lied and tell them that they already mailed it. Not only is happenning to me but also to my two sisters who live in Puerto Rico and still don't have their refunds. I live in California but I'm originally from Puerto Rico and it is embarrasing to read your reviews and to find out that this type of business practice and bad customer service is true. At this point I don't care if I loose my deposit but I am very greatfull to all the people who stayed at this place and took the time to save the horrible experience to me and others. I agreed with everyone else who said that all good reviews of this place must be from the owners. As a puertorican I want you to know that we have great places to visit, but defenetly this is not the one you want for you vacation in PR. I'm glad I cancelled and didn't ruin my vacation back home.

Reviews.Title: “it's true, all the good reviews are from employees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Believe me any bad review you see of this overly expense piece of garbage its true, staff is rude, especially one of the girls of reception Alice or Alicita whatever her name is. There were dogs running all over the place, awful food, and crappy rooms. Puerto Rico is great and it has a lot of beautiful and exciting places, but as in any other country they always have that place that just [---]. Take my advice "Don't go there."

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit the parador villas del mar hau and I must add the place was really nice. The parador was beautiful, surrounded by the beautiful beach. The place was really economical for all which included, you have the opportunity to go swiming at the pool provided and eat at the restaurant that has an international menu, I can confirm the Shrimp Salad on a pita with a butter herb dressing very delicous. The beach which is on the outside of the cottages is superb, your at walking distance about two feet or less and just to be able to get away from your everyday hassle is conforting. Really you haven't visited Puerto Rico until you see this really beautiful hideaway spot.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more, got less”
Reviews.Author: Davunger
Reviews.Content: July and August are not the months to visit this parador. The units are too close to one another, and sound carries. From the blasting music next door, to the woman moving furniture above our bedroom at 6 AM. What's this all about? Management is unable or unwilling to regulate its renters and therefore you have to put up with the luck of the draw. My hunch is that spring or fall might be better times to visit. The parador is on a beautiful beach, really, that is fairly empty once you walk away from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Parador Hau And You Will Too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: HATED THIS PLACE AND YOU WILL TOO! I read the reviews and even called to ask them what was up with all the bad reviews and of course they defended themselves. What an idiot I was. People DO pay attention to all the bad reviews about this place or any other place you are thinking of staying because all are true!!! I learned from this terrible experience I had at this place. This is my description of this place - GROSS! DIRTY Rooms and grounds! BAD SERVICE! Owners would not talk to us about bad service (were hiding-I guess) Rude employees! Wild animals running around the grounds! Pool was more like a mud hole. I called the place next door, much nicer place and cheaper, but unfortunately it was booked. If you are thinking of staying here you better think twice. YOU WILL REGRET IT. I certainly did.
